intro: Inversodicraea cristata, commonly known as the cristate inversodicraea, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
